The Strafford School Foundation is excited to announce the following scholarship winners!

post_text:
Strafford School Foundation is participating in Give Ozarks 2016
A 24-hour online fundraising marathon taking place on Tuesday, May 3!

Around 200 Ozarks nonprofit agencies will be a part of this great event. Give Ozarks 2016 will raise money and awareness of philanthropy in our area.

Our staff and students will benefit from each penny that is donated on May 3! You can support the efforts of the Strafford School Foundation by making a secure donation anytime from midnight to midnight on May 3, 2016. Your contributions at any level will be greatly appreciated! $5, $10, $15... every donation counts. The Foundation will also have opportunities to win cash prizes throughout the day. Many of the prizes are generated by numbers of donors within any given hour, not the amounts of the donations!

All gifts are tax-deductible to the fullest extent allowed by the IRS.
Give Ozarks is just one of many nonprofit online fundraising marathons being hosted by community foundations across the nation on May 3, Give Local America Day.

https://giveozarks.org/2016/strafford-school-foundation

post_text:
The Strafford School Foundation is selling engraved brick pavers that will be laid inside the Indian Walkway at the front of the new high school entrance. There are two options available for purchase:
* 4"x8" Paver will have 3 lines of engraving available for $99
* 8"x8" Paver will have 6 lines of engraving available for $149
These will be available for individuals, groups and businesses to purchase. The entire purchase will be a tax deductible contribution to the Strafford School Foundation.
The link to the order form is available below and can be turned into any building office with payment. Orders placed by March 11, 2016 will be finished in time to be installed when the new entrance is open. The photo of the new entrance shows the pavers laid around the rectangular landscaped area in front of the building.
If you have any questions please contact Marcy Easterly at marcye@straffordschools.net or 736-7000 ext. 1503.

Link for the order form:
http://www.straffordschools.net/userfiles/2/Strafford%20School%20Foundation%20Paver%20Order%20Form(1).pdf

post_text: The Strafford School Foundation is excited to share another first! As a result of the generous support of Strafford High School alumni, Mr. Bill Berry, The Foundation was able award the Bill Berry Grant for the first time this school year. This grant provided by Mr. Berry enabled the Foundation to purchase 10 Chrome Books for the High School. These Chrome Books will allow the integration and incorporation of technology into the classroom, diversify learning styles and engage students.

post_text: The Spearpack (Backpack) Program is back in full swing! A big thank you to Mrs. King's 8th Grade Careers class for helping prepare the Spearpacks. A HUGE thank you to our community for helping make this program a success as we head into our second year ready and able to help 25 kids in need each week. In the coming days as you help your Strafford Indians "Can the Eagles," we thank you in advance for helping the Spearpack Program at the same time! With your help we are helping Strafford students and building a stronger community! Strafford Strong!

post_text: We had an exciting meeting last night and will soon be awarding the first ever grant through the Foundation to a benefit Strafford Schools and Strafford students. Thank you to the teachers and coaches who applied! More on that to come! The first full year of the Spearpack Program is wrapping up and we are ready to continue on in the fall and continue to help eliminate childhood hunger in our schools. Thank you to everyone who has contributed and made the program a success. Together we are building a stronger community starting with our kids.

Thank you to the teachers and coaches who applied! More on that to come! The first full year of the Spearpack Program is wrapping up and we are ready to continue on in the fall and continue to help eliminate childhood hunger in our schools. Thank you to everyone who has contributed and made the program a success. Together we are building a stronger community starting with our kids.

post_text: Exciting meeting tonight ended with making special packs for the Spearpack Program students to enjoy over winter break. Thank you all for helping us make it happen!
text: Exciting meeting tonight ended with making special packs for the Spearpack Program students to enjoy over winter break. Thank you all for helping us make it happen!

post_text:
Spearpacks are handed out by the school nurses each week. Here is a statement from Nurse Anne Stever about the first week packs were handed out: "The first time we handed out Spearpacks it was fun because the students were so happy and excited about the food in them. One student said he could "even make his own dinner when his mom was at work because he knew how to use the microwave.""

Thank you Strafford for helping make this program a success for Strafford students and the Strafford community! #GivingTuesday

post_text: Happy #GivingTuesday friends! We hope you will consider giving to the Strafford a School Foundation today. With your support we are helping Strafford students and strengthening our community. Help us continue and grow the Spear Pack program and begin to impact Strafford schools and students in other meaningful ways. The good work is just getting started thanks to you! On this day dedicated to giving back please consider participating!

Help us continue and grow the Spear Pack program and begin to impact Strafford schools and students in other meaningful ways. The good work is just getting started thanks to you! On this day dedicated to giving back please consider participating!

post_text:
Tomorrow is #givingtuesday - a day globally dedicated to giving back. The Spear Pack program is in full swing- helping 25 Strafford students each week. It is our goal to send out special packs to help those students over the upcoming winter break. As much we enjoy the break, it means several days with no school meals for many students. Please consider giving back. It is easy and tax-deductible!! Visit our site and click GIVE NOW, it will link you to Community Foundation of the Ozarks, put "other" as your designation and type in "Strafford School Foundation" or "Strafford Spear Pack Program." Thank you in advance and thank you to those of you who have already contributed. You are making a difference!
http://www.straffordschoolfoundation.org/

post_text: Today we are thankful for our caring community that has generously allowed us to support Strafford students. Because of you- Each week 25 students are taking home spear-packs of food on Friday to nourish them throughout the weekend. These students now return on Monday able to focus on school, not hunger. May you all have a blessed holiday with those you love. Thank you for making our community and our school stronger.
text: Today we are thankful for our caring community that has generously allowed us to support Strafford students. Because of you- Each week 25 students are taking home spear-packs of food on Friday to nourish them throughout the weekend. These students now return on Monday able to focus on school, not hunger. May you all have a blessed holiday with those you love. Thank you for making our community and our school stronger.

post_text: As we prepare for tonight's meeting we must take the time to thank all of you- In September 2013, with the school's encouragement, we accepted the challenge to establish the Strafford School Foundation. Our goal was, and is, to help the school and its students above and beyond the normal operating budget. With your help and support the Foundation is growing and our first initiative the "Spear Pack," backpack program is sending home a pack with 25 Strafford students each Friday for their nourishment over the weekend. A year ago it seemed like a really big undertaking, but our community has made it happen. We are excited for the opportunity to continue to help Strafford Schools, students, faculty and staff. THANK YOU, STRAFFORD INDIANS!
text: As we prepare for tonight's meeting we must take the time to thank all of you- In September 2013, with the school's encouragement, we accepted the challenge to establish the Strafford School Foundation. With your help and support the Foundation is growing and our first initiative the "Spear Pack," backpack program is sending home a pack with 25 Strafford students each Friday for their nourishment over the weekend. A year ago it seemed like a really big undertaking, but our community has made it happen. We are excited for the opportunity to continue to help Strafford Schools, students, faculty and staff. THANK YOU, STRAFFORD INDIANS!

post_text: The "official" grand total is in- With your support the "Can the Eagles" drive raised $1588.97 to expand and continue the "Spear Pack" Program which is in full swing and currently benefiting 25 Strafford students in need each week. In addition to the grand dollar total you sent hundreds of food items to benefit the food pantry for this program. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU for your generosity and support as we have started the Strafford School Foundation and the Spear Pack program. With your help we are helping Strafford students and making our community stronger.
text: The "official" grand total is in- With your support the "Can the Eagles" drive raised $1588.97 to expand and continue the "Spear Pack" Program which is in full swing and currently benefiting 25 Strafford students in need each week. In addition to the grand dollar total you sent hundreds of food items to benefit the food pantry for this program. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU for your generosity and support as we have started the Strafford School Foundation and the Spear Pack program. With your help we are helping Strafford students and making our community stronger.

post_text: Tonight we assembled 125 Spear Packs, which is 5 weeks worth for the initial 25 students who will benefit from this program. First packs go out this Friday. We hope to continue raising community support and increase the students benefitted by the packs. Thank you for helping us make a difference. Together we are all building a stronger Strafford community starting with our kids! THANK YOU!

post_text: Tomorrow is a big day- the Strafford School Foundation Board is meeting tomorrow evening to assemble the first "spearpacks" - they will go out this week to help Strafford students in need over the weekend! Stay tuned for pictures of our pack assembly meeting and the finished product. Thank you to EVERYONE who has supported this program. We hope to continue to add students as funds are available throughout the school year. We could not do this without our generous Strafford community! THANK YOU!

We hope to continue to add students as funds are available throughout the school year. We could not do this without our generous Strafford community! THANK YOU!

post_text: Exciting news from today's board meeting- Enough funds have been raised to start handing out our first "Spear Packs" (backpacks) in September. Currently there are enough funds to feed 25 Strafford students in need on weekends when school meals are unavailable. The Foundation is so appreciative of the individuals, businesses and organizations who are helping fund this project. A HUGE thanks to the congregation of Harvest Hill Baptist Church for an incredibly generous gift this week. Your kindness and commitment to our community is amazing. 25 Stafford students will wake up on Saturday mornings and have food to eat instead of going hungry until Monday. We hope to add more students to the program and continue raising community support to help Strafford Schools and Strafford students thrive. THANK YOU!

post_text: We hope to visit with you this week about the Strafford School Foundation and the Spearpack Program - Strafford School Foundation representatives will be near the entrance of this evening's junior high track meet from 4-6pm and at Family Fun Night tomorrow evening in the Early Childhood Center from 6-8pm. There will be a display of what will be in the Spearpack backpacks and information on the ways the Foundation can make a difference for Strafford students, faculty and staff!

There will be a display of what will be in the Spearpack backpacks and information on the ways the Foundation can make a difference for Strafford students, faculty and staff!

post_text: The first initiative and fundraising effort of the Strafford School Foundation is the establishment of a backpack program, called the “Spearpack Program.” There are hundreds of children in the Strafford R-6 School District who qualify for free lunch, many of those have very little to eat during times when school meals are unavailable. This program will help a group of those students, selected by school personnel, including counselors and nurses, eat over the weekend by providing a bag of kid-friendly, non-perishable food to take home so these children can return to school on Monday morning ready to learn without the distraction of hunger. The goal is to start handing out "Spearpacks" when students return next fall. You support this program by visiting the Foundation's website http://www.straffordschoolfoundation.org/ and clicking the "Give Now" button. Thank you!

You support this program by visiting the Foundation's website http://www.straffordschoolfoundation.org/ and clicking the "Give Now" button. Thank you!

post_text:
The Strafford School Foundation was recently created to support the students and staff of the Strafford School District by enriching and enhancing their educational opportunities, programs and activities.

The mission of the Foundation is to raise tax-deductible support by partnering with the community to provide above and beyond the school's normal operating budget.

The first initiative and fundraising effort will be to establish a backpack program...called the "Spearpack Program".

Please share this page with your friends and visit our website at www.straffordschoolfoundation.org.

*The foundation is a non-profit, tax-exempt, public corporation managed by the Community Foundation of the Ozarks.
